segment.source: How to Recover a Moved Drive
segment.target: How to Recover a Moved Drive

segment.source: When you move an operating system drive that is encrypted by using Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM), the drive will not accept the PIN that was used in a previous computer because of the change to the Trusted Platform Module (TPM) chip.
segment.target: When you move an operating system drive that is encrypted by using Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM), the drive will not accept the PIN that was used in a previous computer because of the change to the Trusted Platform Module (TPM) chip.

segment.source: To use the moved drive, you will need a way to obtain the recovery key ID to retrieve the recovery password.
segment.target: To use the moved drive, you will need a way to obtain the recovery key ID to retrieve the recovery password.

segment.source: Use the following procedure to recover a drive that has moved.
segment.target: Use the following procedure to recover a drive that has moved.

segment.source: To recover a moved drive
segment.target: To recover a moved drive

segment.source: On the computer that contains the moved drive, start the computer in Windows recovery environment (WinRE) mode, or start the computer by using the Microsoft Diagnostic and Recovery Toolset (DaRT).
segment.target: On the computer that contains the moved drive, start the computer in Windows recovery environment (WinRE) mode, or start the computer by using the Microsoft Diagnostic and Recovery Toolset (DaRT).

segment.source: Once the computer has been started with WinRE or DaRT, Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring will treat the moved operating system drive as a data drive.
segment.target: Once the computer has been started with WinRE or DaRT, Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring will treat the moved operating system drive as a data drive.

segment.source: MBAM will then display the drive’s recovery password ID and ask for the recovery password.
segment.target: MBAM will then display the drive’s recovery password ID and ask for the recovery password.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: In some cases, you may be able to click I forgot the PIN during the startup process, and then enter the recovery mode to display the recovery key ID.
segment.target: In some cases, you may be able to click I forgot the PIN during the startup process, and then enter the recovery mode to display the recovery key ID.

segment.source: Use the recovery key ID to retrieve the recovery password and unlock the drive from the Administration and Monitoring website.
segment.target: Use the recovery key ID to retrieve the recovery password and unlock the drive from the Administration and Monitoring website.

segment.source: If the moved drive was configured to use a TPM chip on the original computer, you must take additional steps after unlocking the drive and completing the start process.
segment.target: If the moved drive was configured to use a TPM chip on the original computer, you must take additional steps after unlocking the drive and completing the start process.

segment.source: In WinRE mode, open a command prompt and use the manage-bde tool to decrypt the drive.
segment.target: In WinRE mode, open a command prompt and use the manage-bde tool to decrypt the drive.

segment.source: Using this tool is the only way to remove the TPM plus PIN protector without the original TPM chip.
segment.target: Using this tool is the only way to remove the TPM plus PIN protector without the original TPM chip.

segment.source: Once the removal is completed, start the computer normally.
segment.target: Once the removal is completed, start the computer normally.

segment.source: The MBAM agent will now enforce the policy to encrypt the drive with the new computer’s TPM plus PIN.
segment.target: The MBAM agent will now enforce the policy to encrypt the drive with the new computer’s TPM plus PIN.
